xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels
Class HybridKernelDensityEstimator

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.Function<Number,Double>
      xxl.core.math.functions.AbstractRealFunctionFunction
          xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.AbstractKernelDensityEstimator
              xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.HybridKernelDensityEstimator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, RealFunction
public class HybridKernelDensityEstimator
extends AbstractKernelDensityEstimator

This class provides an implementation of a kernel based density estimator based upon a simple random sample for data given by objects of type Number. The estimator is updatable, so one can use it as an aggregate function combined with a special aggregation iterator. This class implements a special kind of kernel density estimators using a hybrid technique first performed by Blohsfeld et. al. in
[BKS99]: Björn Blohsfeld, Dieter Korus, Bernhard Seeger: A Comparison of Selectivity Estimators for Range Queries on Metric Attributes. SIGMOD Conference 1999: 239-250.
Generally, a set of separate kernel based density estimators is given whereas each one is assigned to a partial interval respectively bin. The bins in turn build a partition of the x-Axis. There, the borders should correspond to change points of the estimated pdf. These change points can be estimated, if they are not a priori known. The estimators of the bins are kernel density estimators using reflection as a boundary treatment. See ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator for details about using reflection.
The estimator is implemented as a one-dimensional function expecting objects of type Number as well as a RealFunction expecting data of type double. A sample of any kind of data given by an iterator could be easily obtained through the reservoir sampler cursor.

See Also:
Aggregator, Iterator, Function, KernelFunction, KernelBandwidths, AbstractKernelDensityEstimator, NativeKernelDensityEstimator, ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator, NativeKernelDensityEstimator.FACTORY, ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator.FACTORY, Serialized Form

protected boolean automaticBandwidthMode
Indicates whether the bandwidths are computed based upon the normal scale rule using the sample. If set to false, the user has to assign the bandwidths

FACTORY

public static Function FACTORY
Provides a factory for a hybrid kernel density estimator The parameters needed for construction are passed to the factory by an Object[] o containing:
o[0]: used kernel function
o[1]: used sample as Object[] containing numerical data
o[2]: used change points as Object[] containing numerical data
o[3]: used bandwidths as Object[]
o[4]: minimum
o[5]: maximum
o[6]: confidence level

Constructor Detail

HybridKernelDensityEstimator

public HybridKernelDensityEstimator(KernelFunction kf,
                                    Object[] sample,
                                    Object[] changePoints,
                                    double[] hs,
                                    double min,
                                    double max,
                                    double alpha,
                                    Function kernelDensityEstimatorFactory)
Constructs an estimator for a density function using the given kernel function by defining separate estimators for a well-defined partition of the x-axis.

Parameters:
kf - used Kernel function
sample - sample of a data set given as Object[] containing objects of type Number
changePoints - points where to "break" the sample
hs - used bandwidths for the bins. If set to null automatic smoothing using the normal scale rule will be performed
min - left border of the data space
max - right border of the data space
alpha - confidence level used for computing an asymptotic pointwise confidence interval
kernelDensityEstimatorFactory - a factory delivering kernel estimators used for the bins

HybridKernelDensityEstimator

public HybridKernelDensityEstimator(KernelFunction kf,
                                    Object[] sample,
                                    Object[] changePoints,
                                    double[] hs,
                                    double min,
                                    double max)
Constructs an estimator for a density function using the given kernel function by defining separate estimators for a well-defined partition of the x-axis.

Parameters:
kf - used Kernel function
sample - sample of a data set given as Object[] containing objects of type Number.
changePoints - points where to "break" the sample rsp. where to bound the bins
hs - used bandwidths for the bins. If set to null automatic smoothing using the normal scale rule will be performmed.
min - left border of the data space
max - right border of the data space

Evaluates the kernel based density estimator at given point x.

Specified by:

Parameters:
x - argument where to evaluate the density estimation
Returns:

setBounds

public void setBounds(double newMin,
                      double newMax)
Sets the new bounds ,e.g., lower and upper border of the given data or the treated domain space.

Parameters:
newMin - new lower border
newMax - new upper border

setChangePoints

public void setChangePoints(Object[] cp)
Sets the new change points ,e.g., the data points determining the bins. If the number of used change points needs to be changed, do it first, than give the new bandwidths.

Parameters:
cp - new change points used for partitioning

setBandwidths

public void setBandwidths(double[] newBandwidths)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
Sets the new bandwidths. If the number of used change points needs to be changed, the new change points must be given BEFORE updating the bandwidths or an IllegalArgumentException occurs. The given bandwidths are used in the given order corresponding to the ascending orderd bins.

Parameters:
newBandwidths - new bandwidths to use. If set to null automatic smoothing is enabled.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the number of bandwidths does not correspond to the number of bins used for estimation (the number of change points +1)

reinit

protected void reinit()
Reinitilizes the estimator after changes.

Overrides:
reinit in class AbstractKernelDensityEstimator

split

public static Object[] split(Object[] data,
                             Object[] borders)
Splits given data into subarrays bounded by the given borders.

Parameters:
data - points to split into disjoint subarrays
borders - borders of the bins
Returns:
an Object[] containing Objects of type Object[] filled with data that hold
borders[i] <= min(i) <= max(i) < borders[i+1], i=0, ..., boerders.length-1
.

                             Object[] borders,
                             Comparator comparator)

Parameters:
data - points to split into disjoint subarrays
borders - borders of the bins
comparator - user-defined comparator
Returns:
an Object[] containing Objects of type Object[] filled with data that hold
borders[i] <= min(i) <= max(i) < borders[i+1], i=0, ..., boerders.length-1
.
